intro: Citharexylum cooperi, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3 to 10 meters. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in clusters. Citharexylum cooperi thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and moist forests.
